result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE may contact the COCC office to set up a payment plan.

Upon failure to pay, the Court may;

 Enter a civil judgment
 Intercept your income taxes
 Suspend your driving privilege on TR/CT cases
 Send debt to Department of Revenue.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
1:14 PM Defendant Robin L Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg appeared by video for Robin L Smith.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Atty Osberg recites the agreement into the court record.  DE waives her right to personal appearance, court will accept waiver.  

Agreement reached-Atty recites agreement.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of NC, finds DE guilty.   Court will make agreement an order of the court.  DE may enter into a payment plan.  Adj 1:23pm
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 19, 2022 at 08:00 am.

1:22 PM Defendant Robin L Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Robin L Smith.  Attorney Annette M Barna in court for State of Wisconsin. Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts. Set for JT September 19, 2022.
Bond letter mailed to DE with instructions to return within time limits.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:30 PM Defendant Robin L Smith in court with attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robin L Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Per Atty Osberg DE has some health issues that prevent her from driving so appears via ZOOM.  $1500.00 sign bond, all conditions remain.  State objects to sign bond.  Set for Adj Init App May 24, 2022 @ 1:00PM.  IN PERSON.
